availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Trimble County, Kentucky, merchant and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sena B. Duncan Chowning in Trimble County, Kentucky on February 5, 1839. Father of Mary Chowning, Eliza J. Chowning, Charles Chowning, William Chowning, and Lucy T. Chowning. Resident of Trimble County, Kentucky in 1840. Owned four enslaved persons in Trimble County in 1840. Merchant and inn keeper in Carroll County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Carroll County in 1850. Farmer in Trimble County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Trimble County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, p. 319.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, District 2, p. 211B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, District 2, p. 908.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, p. 286.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, p. 398A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trimble County Marriages, Film #000420387, p. 348.
Find A Grave, "James Chowning (1810-1875)," Memorial #187311477, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/187311477 (accessed September 11, 2020).
